clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of In-Home Addiction Treatment for First Responders
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of an In-Home Treatment Program for First Responders With Substance Use Disorder: A Retrospective Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective analysis to evaluate impact of an in-home addiction treatment program on first responders with substance use disorder.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this retrospective study is to evaluate the effects of in-home addiction treatment on first responders with substance use disorder. Treatment engagement, hospitalizations, detox and residential addiction treatment admissions, and lethal overdoses will be measured. Although not the primary focus, recidivism and relapse will be measured.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured throughout 365 day duration of anticipated length of stay
primary_outcome.description: Participation in In-Home Addiction Treatment Program using length of stay reports

primary_outcome.time_frame: Conducted monthly throughout 365 day anticipated length of stay in program
primary_outcome.description: Measure change in client report of symptoms related to substance use disorder

primary_outcome.time_frame: Completed at week 3 or 4, Week 30, Week 35, Week 44, and Week 50 throughout 52 week anticipated length of program participation
primary_outcome.description: Measures changes in quality of life using client self-report inquiring about employment, connection to care team, community engagement using yes/no/not applicable response scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomly administered throughout 365 day anticipated length of program participation
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of substance use measured through urine drug screening and breathalyzer tests

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured throughout 365 day anticipated length of program participation
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of Emergency Room and Inpatient hospital admissions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured throughout 365 day anticipated length of program participation
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of residential treatment and detox admission

arm_group.arm_group_label: First Responders in In-Home Addiction Treatment Program
arm_group.description: - First responders (individual who does or has worked as a police officer, fire fighter, corrections officer, military police, emergency medical technician, paramedic, parole or probation officer)

intervention.description: Treatment was delivered per treatment protocol Primary IHAT Care Team consisted of a licensed Care Coordinator (LPN, RN, MSW, LPC, or LMFT) and two Recovery Advisors Urine drug screens administered randomly Appointments were scheduled per protocol for 52 weeks Within first two weeks of care, all clients are provided an evaluation by a psychiatrist to ensure fitness for program
intervention.arm_group_label: First Responders in In-Home Addiction Treatment Program

study_pop.textblock: Approximately 15 individuals with substance use disorder who are or have served as a first responder (police officer, fire fighter, corrections officer, military police, emergency medical technician, paramedic, parole or probation officer) and were enrolled in Aware Recovery Care's In-Home Addiction Treatment program between April 2017 and March 2019.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Client is or has been a first responder
- Client enrolled in Aware Recovery Care after April 2017
- Client discharged from Aware Recovery Care before March 2019
- Client has primary substance use disorder diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Client has never been first responder
- Client moved out of service area or lost insurance during care
